doc.previous: In 2013, the tricentennial of Diderot's birth, his hometown of Langres held a series of events in his honor and produced an audio tour of the town highlighting places that were part of Diderot's past, including the remains of the convent where his sister AngÃ©lique took her vows.[23] On October 6, 2013, a museum of theEnlightenment focusing on Diderot's contributions to the movement, the Maison des LumiÃ¨res Denis Diderot, was inaugurated in Langres.[24] http://www.rossettiarchive.org/docs/s259a.rap.html
